results.description: We will try to make some sense of the bewildering array of events unfolding in our city, nation, world, and lifetimes by placing them in a historical context. A meetup for historians, news junkies, and conversationalists.
results.name: Current Events Discussion

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk toward the back of the lobby, we'll be on the raised section on the left.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description:
Join us as we visit New York's famous Tibetan Museum. Located in the Chelsea area this museum is known for bringing the most trendiest arts from the east.

We will enjoy Tibetan fine art, historical and religious and enjoy the music and happy hour drinks.

We will meet at the bar and do a quick tour of the museum. When competed touring we enjoy the remaining of the night in the RMA bar area for music and film. We end our night with a free movie when you purchase a drink form their bar.

Rubin Exhibitions

Gateway to Himalayan Art


Honoring Nepal 

Becoming Another


Masterworks


Sacred Places

Admission to the galleries is free from 6:00 to 10:00 p.m.

Hold on to your receipt when you purchase a drink you get a ticket to their independent film for the night. PLEASE NOTE WE  NEVER STAY UNTIL THE MOVIE

Music:

DJ Tyger Lilly

Tyger Lilly's unconditional love for music was passed down from her grandfather, well-known jazz musician Jarius Elliott. She is constantly influenced by her surroundings, and such greats as Miles Davis, Nina Simone, and Fela Kuti. Tyger is one of the few artists to successfully blend the core of hip-hop and house with the glamour of mainstream.

K2 Lounge
Every Friday night the Café @ RMA becomes the K2 Lounge, offering a special Pan Asian Tapas menu to accompany the evening's DJ and unique thematic gallery tours and programs.

Films
At 9:30 p.m. be sure to catch Cabaret Cinema, where movies and martinis mix. Each film is introduced by a notable guest to provide context.

La Jetée

Cabaret Cinema

October 23

9:30 - 10:30 PM

Free ticket with a $7 bar minimum. | Learn More

*****************************************

The Night's Event - Itinerary

Please note that we will be meeting in the lobby lounge area.

Located on the ground level to the left of entry.

We have a reserved area will be near the DJ & Bar.

Our meet up time is 6 pm Friday.

We will spend the first hour as a "meet and greet".

At this time Happy Hour should be taking place, Two for one on selected wines and beverages.

I will introduce members and at 7:15-30 after finishing our drinks we will make our way to the top floor and experience the museum.

Do(s) & Don't(s)

This is a camera friendly museum.

There are certain locations that cameras are not allowed.

One of them happens to be the Tibetan shrine room.

Alcohol is not allowed on the floor of the exhibits.

There will be a huge arrival of guest therefore an after event of restaurant will be impossible. There is a the new spring "Serai" which also provides food, if anyone is interested, You can eat at the Rubin.

If you can not attend, now will be the time to cancel (please remove your rsvp)

Olisa

Since everyone had a great time at the first trip to MoMa I'm scheduling this meetup again so others can attend too. (If you attended a previous MoMa event and want to attend again that is fine too).

Enter the MoMA museum lobby through the main entrance on 53rd Street. Meet me near the indoor Design and Book Store gift shop entrance (see photo).

(Don't go to the MoMA Design Store across the street).

results.description:
Let's get together and trade some Disney pins!! Some people come with just a lanyard full of pins other come with a stack of books full of pins.  Either way we welcome you to our group.  We are happy to answer any questions that you may have about pins and will try to guide all of the new traders in a direction of years of fun and trading.  We will meet from 6-9PM in the food court just outside of the elevators.  We hope to see you there.

 

We ask that you not bring food since we are in the mall food court.  Please plan on buying something such as a drink at the very least so that we are actually adding to the mall's profits.  We are using their space after all for free.

 

I appreciate your RSVP so I know who to look for or not.

 

You can email me at [masked] anytime for a faster response.

My wife and I don't always get to the pin meet due to our kids social lives.   Other people do go, but if you are coming for the first time I want to make sure that we are there to greet you and make you feel comfortable.

 

Please feel free to email me with any questions that you may have.

 

Thanks,

Steven
results.how_to_find_us: Convieniently located off of route 17 and the NJ Garden State Parkway.
results.name: Disney Pin Trading at Paramus Park Mall!!!

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
After the very successful first meetup organized, there is no reason not to do it again...and again! This event is now recurring every fourth Friday of every month, so mark your calendars, ladies! Please see "upcoming meetups" section for the exact dates. 

How to join:

Mark yourself as attending, and if you wish, inbox me your personal info (phone and email) so it is easier to coordinate. 

Going forward, we are expelling all the members who RSVP-ed but did not make it to our events without cancelling 24h in advance. We apologize, but we have to ensure high quality  standards for our upcoming meetups by restricting the meetups to 15 people maximum.


Where the event will be held: 

The exact location is only visible to the members of this group and may change every time a new meetup is organized based on recommendations. Please see "location details" to find out where this meetup will be held. 

You can bring a +1 or +2, no need to ask me beforehand. The more, the merrier! 

I am looking forward to meeting all of you!  

Cindy

results.description:
It's time for a fun run. This run calls for everything NEON, GLOW IN THE DARK, REFLECTIVE, ANYTHING THAT BLINKS OR FLASHES. So, pull out all your reflective gear for this social run/walk. All paces are welcome!!! Walkers are welcomes!!! KIDS are welcomed. Route still undecided, TBA.

Bag check at the running company in The Time Warner building. Please bring your own lock. ☆☆☆Free bracelets & necklaces for everyone ☆☆☆

I have attached a simple 3 mile route for Friday's Neon fun run/walk. It's a little over 2 laps of the lower inner loop. Starting atvthe Columbus circke entrance. For those of you with children, you can do 1 loop and it would be alittle over 1 mile. Please remember were meeting at the Running company in Columbus Circle from 6pm-630pm. For pictures and gear check. A.K.A. getting your glow stick game on!! LMK if you have questions. Cant wait to see everyone. :)

results.description:
Hello All!

This month will cover the basics of electrical engineering and see how alarm work. We will look at IC chips and infrared. Sean BSEE from NYU will be teaching a 30 minute lecture follow by a DIY session.

The workshop costs $20, a lot cheaper than a lot of electronics classes. What's even better is come with a friend and get 25% off!

What does $20 include?

• 30 minute lecture on basic circuitry, IC Chip, infrared, and diodes.


• DIY Materials: 3V Battery, battery clips, jumper wires, breadboard,  LED lights, piezo buzzer, IC Chip, IR LED, diodes, resistors and worksheets.

We normally go to a bar afterwards, feel free to join us! :)
results.how_to_find_us: When you walk into the cospace, we are on the right. Look for me, Jaime. I'll be wearing orange since Halloween is coming up :)
results.name: Basic Circuits & Alarm

results.description:
We will be holding a Fire Ceremony at Neolyth in Montclair, NJ. This will be a chance to come and let go of anything that no longer serves you. This sacred ceremony will help transform unwanted energy or patterns of fear, anger, or doubt in our lives into something powerful and positive. 

Please note this is a high energy ceremony where we will work together as a community and support one another as we each take our turn letting go.

Things to bring:

A rattle if you have one (if not, rattle will be provided)

Click Sticks (also provided)

Your intentions on what you want to let go of. We suggest you focus on one thing and really work with that. 

We will be holding a lively Kirtan after the fire ceremony just in case we want to keep up with the high energy we will produce.

Admittance for the Fire ceremony is $25 at the door.
results.name: Special Fire Ceremony

results.description:
Hey Brooklyn Swing Friends!

SWING DANCE with Dancewave this Friday at our East Coast Swing Class

6:30-7:30pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn!

Want to learn to Swing Dance? Intimidated by the "Pros"? Here's your chance to learn the basics of swing that will get your feet hoppin! Build your swing dance vocabulary each week as we learn a new step every class! Suzie Q, Hammerlock, and Swivel your way to become a pro! East Coast Swing is a fun and easy-to-learn class is not only good exercise, but it's a great way to meet new people and make new friends! Classes are designed for both drop-in students and regular attendees, so even if you can't attend every class, you'll still be able to pick up the moves, have fun and make great progress in your swing technique. No dance partner is necessary, as we will rotate dance partners throughout class. Each month we'll learn a new dance routine so there will always be new material to learn! 

Join us every Friday from 6:30 – 7:30 pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn

For more information about Dancewave’s Swing Class –  CLICK HERE!

Questions?  <a>[masked]</a>
results.name: Brooklyn Swing Dance Fall Meetup

results.description:
Come have a glass of wine, and learn fun ways to create beautiful handmade card projects. The cost for each class is $20.00 which includes 3 hours of class time and a kit of all the paper supplies needed to create your Make and Take copy of each project.  Bring your favorite adhesive (tape runner, wet glue and/foam pop up tape.)

We will start out the evening with a look at each sample of the ready-made projects for the night. I will show you step by step how to construct each.  You then get your chance to play with Stampin’ Up! products and learn about the tools and supplies that are used in the world of card making and paper crafting.

By the end of the evening, once you have finished your glass of wine and completed your projects, you will get a supplies cheat sheet listing the sizes, dimensions, stamp sets, dies and tools used during the class. 

You also get an Exclusive YT web address to a video demo - all projects in one YT video that only class attendees can access.

Need more information please feel free to send me a message.

Card Making 5 Session Series:. 

  Wednesday ... September 23rd : Basic Paper, Layers & Backgrounds 

  Friday ... October 23th : Die-Cuts & Punches

  Friday ... November 6th : Inking & Stencils

  Friday ... November 20th : Wet & Dry Embossing

 Friday ... December 4th : Fancy Folds & Interactive Cards

Join in the whole series or come for the class that grabs you.
results.name: Well Wishes & Wine Card Classes

results.description:
This introduction to the meditative quietness in landscape photography will be led by Ajit Menon is a hobbyist photographer who loves to travel to regions of isolation for his photographic pursuits. 


Ajit Menon's photography is something that has developed over time from a mere hobby to a serious pursuit of the beauty of nature. He also enjoys using the process of "long exposure" to amplify the passage of time, thus further abstracting the image from a momentary snapshot to a dreamy slice of time. Mr. Menon's photographs have been published in a variety of media and publications such as B&W and Outdoor Photographer. He has also won many commendations for his photography and has been widely praised for his photographic style.


The event is open to everyone to attend. It's free for all Art Fast participants and 'pay as you wish' for others to cover the cost of the event . Space is limited so if you wish to participate please RSVP: [masked]
results.name: The Silence Of Photography

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
A fictionalized retelling of Oscar-winner Shirley Clarke’s 1967 film Portrait of Jason, Stephen Winter’s Jason and Shirley filets the meaty racial, social, and sexual issues raised by the original documentary encounter. Artist and filmmaker Jack Waters doesn’t so much play as channel Jason Holliday, the aging hustler, wannabe/has-been cabaret artist and lascivious lush that so fascinates and infuriates Clarke (incarnated here by renowned writer Sarah Schulman).

Introduced by the filmmaker and post-screening discussion with Stephen Winter and Jack Waters, moderated by Steven G. Fullwood, Assistant Curator, Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, Manuscripts, Archives and Rare Books Division.
results.name: MoMA Presents: Stephen Winter’s Jason and Shirley

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Body Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!

results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
LEARN the PROFITABLE WORLD of REALITY TV


 WHAT IS HAPPENING:


The Reality of Reality TV delves into the unscripted world of television giving insights and anecdotes on how some of the most popular shows on television actually get made. 


Given by Marcia Mule', executive producer and co-creator of the EMMY ward winning show-Kathy Griffin: My Life on the -List, Executive Producer of The Real Housewives of Atlanta and The A-List NY and who most recently developed and sold Untying the Knot to Bravo, now going into season two.



 YOU WILL LEARN:

How does a show go from inception to development to pitch to air?

Marcia will outline the extensive development process and shed light on the ever-changing landscape of television as we know it. 

How are viewer habits and appetites changing and is reality television here to stay?

Also, learn how your REALITY ideas are scrutinized and vetted.


WHO IS IT FOR:

Any writer that wants to learn the complex and profitable world of REALITY TV


BIO: 


MARCIA MULÉ is President of Marcia Mule’ Productions, Inc where she is currently developing new series concepts along with other digital niche areas of programming. Formerly Head of Programming at Engel Entertainment where she oversaw the company’s programming slate, Marcia lent her editorial hand over the first two seasons of Animal Planet’s North Woods Law, a series following the Maine Game Wardens on their daily calls of the wild. 


She was also instrumental in developing Untying The Knot which recently premiered on Bravo. In addition to her role as Head of Programming, Marcia oversaw multiple casting efforts, sizzle production as well as paid development presentations and pilots for VH1, Bravo, Travel Channel, Cooking Channel, Syfy, Lifetime, and Science Channel. During her two years there she shepherded several original ideas from inception to market, where she maintains good relationships with a healthy array of buyers and programming executives.


Prior to joining Engel in 2011, Marcia was VP/Head of Programming at True Entertainment, an Endemol company, where she oversaw Bravo’s ratings blockbuster The Real Housewives of Atlanta for two seasons. She also helped cast and launch Logo’s hit docu-series, The A-List: New York. While at True Entertainment she also played a key role in revamping the formats of Whose Weddings is it Anyway? for the Style Network, launched the competition build series, Catch it Keep It for Discovery’s Science Channel and Emergency Level One, for TLC, a verité series set in one of the Nation’s busiest trauma wards.


In 1997, Marcia co-founded Picture This Television, a full service production company best known for Bravo’s hit series, the two-time, Emmy Award® winning Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List and Celebrity Poker Showdown. During her eleven years as co-owner, Picture This Television developed and produced programming for Bravo, Lifetime, Oxygen, MTV, HGTV, Food Network, WeTV, Logo, PBS, and Buena Vista. Upon its inception, the company launched TV411, a groundbreaking educational series targeting the nation’s 90 million functionally illiterate adults. Over the course of three seasons, the series won two Emmy® Awards and became one of the largest literacy initiatives in the country.

Marcia is currently working in Development for My Entertainment and currently has several series concepts at various cable networks. 


 WHERE:

Studio 353

353 west 48th Street

follow the signs

WHEN:

October 23rd

FRIDAY EVENING

7PM to 9PM

MEMBER PRICE:

$24.99


PAYPAL NOW to  RESERVE a SPOT


or


RSVP and PAY CASH at the DOOR

From its genesis as a response to the epidemics of gang violence, drugs, and a poor education system in 1970s New York, to its emergence as a global juggernaut, hip-hop is a uniquely American art form that has captivated the eyes and ears of the world.  


Made You Look features four powerful documentaries that examine hip-hop’s evolution from the streets of 1970s New York to the present day. 

"Shake The Dust" October 23, 2015 @7pm(THIS MEETUP)


Shake the Dust chronicles the influence and impact of breakdancing around the world and will be followed by a Q&A discussion led by series curator Martha Diaz.

Tickets: $12 ($9 for senior citizens and students)


Use code HIPHOPFAM for 25% off admission. 


Seating is limited so reserve yours TODAY.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

results.description: Join us for our second dinner small group "Connections in Clarke" at 7pm. During this time we will gather and ask one another "How is it with your soul?" in the spirit of John Wesley. The purpose of this time is to create moments of spiritual growth for each of us as individuals and as a group; moments where God is speaking, love is present, and grace abounds. Come join us, bring a friend!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.how_to_find_us: $5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

We have no control over how life shows up. Saying YES (and meaning it) is a skill–set that you will develop and strengthen in this seminar. From here, the circumstances of your life cease to disturb you and problems dissolve.

results.description:
Thank you to everyone who came to our last Game Night!  It was heaps of fun and conquest!   :)

We hope you join us on our next Game Night for a chance to meet tons of new people, play some great games, and drink a few beers. And make sure to invite your friends! We'll have Jamaican/Caribbean dominoes as well. This is one of our favorite strategy games and we would love to share it with the experienced and inexperienced alike.

In addition to dominoes, we will have Settlers of Catan, King of Tokyo, BANG!, Cards Against Humanity, and others. If you'd like to bring your own games, there will be lots of people who like to learn new games.  And again, all are welcome!

Also make sure to bring some cash for a donation.  Though donations are not required, if you are able to donate we suggest $5 for gaming and $5-10 if you're drinking and gaming. Organizing this is 100% volunteer and all the money goes to this MU page, refreshments, and renting the space.

We do not provide food, but there are lots of take-out and delivery options nearby.

See you there!!

results.description:
Greetings Heroes! 

It is with great pride that we can announce that eSports Hero andNebulous Gaming NYC have officially partnered in hopes that together we can provide the gamers of New York City with a strong community and a new place to call home. Located in Manhattan's Lower East Side, we are going to turn the 2,500+ square foot private venue into the hub for all gaming and eSports events on the East Coast.

With that said, bring out your laptop, phone, or tablet and join us for an evening of food, friends, and Hearthstone as we celebrate the re-launch of Nebulous Gaming NYC.

---

We are taking the traditional Fireside format up a notch and you can expect that every week there will be at least one of the following taking place: (1) Deckbuilding Competition, (2) Challenge Stone Tournament, (3) Double Team Tournament (2v2), (4) Conquest Tournament.

As an official part of the Blizzard FSG program we will also do our very best to provide our Hearthstone community with Card Packs, and anything Swag Blizzard passes on to us.

$6 is the Grand Opening Price Discount and the cover will be collected at the door. Once you pay, feel free to stay as late as your heart desires (or at least until close which is usually around midnight). There are cool funky bodegas right around nebs where you can grab snacks / sandwiches throughout the night.

Nebulous Gaming NYC: 

https://www.facebook.com/NebulousGaming

---

The new Nebulous Venue is beautiful and very chill. The WiFi is blazing fast and there are power outlets for everyone. There will be Pizza, board games, Digital Darts, and snacks / beverages available for purchase on site. 

*Pro Gamers / VIPs will be in attendance. *

Pre-Register via meetup. 150 Person Capacity.

---

Leadership Opportunities:

We need someone that is passionate about Hearthstone and is willing to help spearhead this weekly Fireside as a Community Leader. If you are interested in helping us run events in NYC, please reach out. Forward your resume to [masked]

---

For More information about our partners check out the following links:

Nebulous Gaming NYC: https://www.facebook.com/NebulousGaming

Hearthlytics: 

http://hearthlytics.com

Blizzard FSG: 

http://us.battle.net/hearthstone/en/fireside-gatherings 

2ARC Gaming:

http://2arcgaming.com/ 

Vicious Syndicate: 

http://www.vicioushs.cards/
results.name: Hearthstone Fireside Gathering at Nebulous

results.description:
--What is the Open Source Pop-Up Dinner?--
The Pop-Up Dinner is a salon-style conversation over dinner. Guests meet to eat good food, think about art, and discuss the topic of the evening. During each Pop-Up Dinner, special guests will be in attendance to guide the conversation and offer their expertise.

--Who are the special guests?--
The guests for this Pop-Up Dinner will be photographer Bill Arnold, artist Leigh Davis, and filmmaker Keith Miller.

--What’s for Dinner?--
Butternut squash soup with crème fraîche
Eggplant ragout with phyllo dough wing
Braised beef spare ribs over parsnip puree with sauteed spinach
Molten chocolate baby cakes

--What’s the theme?--
It’s a secret… Upon your RSVP, you will receive the theme that will be discussed the night of the dinner. 

--How much does it cost?--
$75 gets you a four-course meal paired with excellent wine (selected by Thad Morrow of Bacaro and Blue Apron). All proceeds support Open Source programming.

--Sounds great! Where is it?--
Well...that’s also a secret. We can only tell you that the event will be held in Park Slope, Brooklyn. On the day before the dinner, we will send you the exact location.

Make your reservation here!
results.name: Open Source Pop-Up Dinner [5 tickets left]

group.name: Secret Dining - Supper Clubs in New York

results.description:
Let's go to Lilly's,,  on Friday Oct 23rd -- its a new restaurant located in downtown White Plains, offering a selection of small plates, artisan pizzas, wines on tap and a great selection of seafood, including a raw bar. I'll make a reservation for 12 and we'll be seated at 7:30.. 

The buzz is happening for this new place that replaces the Porter House.. 

One diner writes, "This is pretty much my holy grail of wine bars. I've been here with friends a few times so far, usually for dinner & drinks during Friday happy hour. Everything about this place is classy & well done, far superior to most of the other bars/restaurants on Mamaroneck Ave. The wine: Lily's has a wonderful selection of wine on tap, which can be hard to find. Although it is mostly domestic wines, there's good variety & quality. From these, I particularly recommend the A to Z Chardonnay & the Concannon Cabernet Sauvignon. Aside from the wine on tap, there are a few other wines that can be ordered by the glass & then a great selection of wines by the bottle. Here they have a wide selection of quality wines that one would expect from a wine bar. I'm particularly impressed by the variety of Italian wines.

Aside from wine, there is a great selection of beers and a full bar. During happy hour (Mon-Fri 4-7pm), beer and wine on tap is only $5!  

The food: I've tried two of the personal pizza selections at Lily's - pizza fresca & meat stacking pizza. They are generous sizes & are delicious, with fresh, quality ingredients. Friends of mine have tried the swordfish & the pasta bolognese & both received good reviews. i'm eager to try more of the food here."


From Eat Drink Post Westchester Magazine: 

Small Plates: $5-$13; pizzas $12-$16; entrées $15-$24

Burrata, tomato jam, pesto, and vincotto

A charcuterie plate

A platter of oysters from the raw bar

Brussels sprouts with Caesar dressing and Parmesan

Ricotta croquettes

Short ribs with polenta and herb salad

The funghi misti pizza comes with shiitake, portobello, and cremini mushrooms plus mozzarella, roasted garlic, and grana padano

Shrimp with pimiento, lemon, and tarragon
results.how_to_find_us: please find us at the bar..
results.name: Let's go to Lily's in White Plains for Drinks and Small Plates

results.description:
Let's take advantage of all the cool stuff happening in October. 

Note: Tickets will sell fast, so please get yours ASAP. Let's all get 9:30 PM tickets. We will get dinner after.

From the website: "Are you ready to be scared out of your mind?

Taking the tale of The Legend of Sleepy Hollow to its darkest extremes, Horseman’s Hollow returns to the village for 15 evenings of highly entertaining haunted mayhem.

Philipsburg Manor transforms into a terrifying landscape ruled by the undead, the evil, and the insane. Visitors begin walking a haunted trail, stumbling upon scary scenes of a town driven mad by the Headless Horseman. The Hollow’s unfortunate inhabitants are all too ready to keep visitors from ever leaving. Creatures, human and otherwise, lurk in the shadows, ready to terrify the unsuspecting while incredible special effects disorient and unsettle. Elaborate costumes and the work of award-wining feature-film makeup artists make it all too real.

Those who survive the trail enter the terrifying ruins of Ichabod’s Schoolhouse, where they must endure a twisted maze of horrors too terrible to describe, only to end up in the lair of the Horseman. Heads will definitely roll…maybe even your own! This is Sleepy Hollow’s premier haunted attraction, right in the heart of the village. Most nights SELL OUT IN ADVANCE.

WARNING: This event is NOT suitable for adults who are claustrophobic, have heart or respiratory conditions, are prone to seizures, or have other chronic health conditions. Enter at your own risk!"
results.name: Horseman's Hollow (Sleepy Hollow)

results.description:
Note to regular attendees: Our new home is 748 Union St. @ 6th Ave. We will be meeting there for the next year while the Gowanus Arts Building undergoes renovations.

Come draw from a live nude model!

The fee for this meetup is $15 per person. Drawing is every first, second and third Friday of the month, 7-9pm.

We focus on short, challenging poses (though we include a few 10- or 15-minute poses on request). This is designed to help artists of all levels to get back to basics and focus on the gesture behind the pose. Artists must bring their own materials: charcoal, pens, watercolors, gouache, pencils, and newsprint or sketch pads are ideal, but feel free to experiment with any media you want to bring!

See you soon and happy drawing!

results.description:
Introduction To Nurturing Each Other Support Group With Dr. Jay Kantor

During the past 25 years Dr. Jay Kantor has developed  an effective holistic approach to resolving long-term psychological, emotional, and relationship issues.  Dr Kantor has developed an approach that combines Energy Psychology in the form of EFT – Emotional Freedom Techniques – with Inner Child Work and Reparenting.  These methods fundamentally restructure the mind that is currently producing disturbing symptoms and problems.  They have been found effective even when previous talk or drug therapies have failed.

Jay will explain and demonstrate these methods in advance of a new support group he will be offering to permit people to experience these therapies in an affordable manner.  The new group called Nurturing Each Other will be announced soon and allow people to get the help they need to finally overcome lifelong psychological, emotional, and relationship problems.

Program starts at 7:30PM.

Dr. Kantor’s website:

http://drjaykantor.com
results.name: Introduction To Nurturing Each Other Support Group With Dr. Jay Kantor

Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 12AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie.

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)

results.description:
Have you ever seen a movie based on a Jane Austin novel, like Pride and Prejudice, and admired the dance scenes? Looking for a way to meet people of all ages, learn a new skill, and exercise your mind and body all at the same time?

Come join us for a free evening of English country dance with a live band and caller! This dance will be geared towards beginners and there will be plenty of friendly, experienced English country dancers to partner up with you and make sure you have a great time.

To get a sense of what an English country dance looks like, click here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KnZbYtbxmnE

Please bring soft soled dancing shoes and a water bottle. We request that our guests and members avoid wearing scents or strongly scented products on the dance floor.

This event is partially sponsored by Country Dance * New York, which has been hosting English country and contra dancing at The Church of the Village for over seventy years. We can be found in the gym on the lower level of the church almost every Tuesday evening at 7:00, between early September and mid June.

The church is easily accessible to all public transit: Take the 1,2, 3, A, C, E, F, or M trains to 14th street. The church is a lovely stone building on the northwest corner of 13th street and 7th avenue.

For more information, check out our website:

http://cdny.org

And join us on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/
results.name: English as a Second Language: Free English Country Dance!

results.description:
SPECIAL EVENT!!!!  FREE ADMISSION!!!!

Beverly Francis will call a beginner friendly English country dance with live musical accompaniment.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  FREE! FREE!  FREE!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!

results.description:
I'm a farm-to-table chef living in Inwood, aka "Upstate Manhattan" the beautiful park community with almost nowhere good to eat. I'm doing what I can to change that through pop-ups and the occasional secret dinner in my apartment. My approach is ingredients-based, i.e. I find something beautiful and build a dish around it. There are no other rules, although my style tends towards the rustic. Here's the menu(there will be beverage options of course): Caramelized onion, manchego, & white anchovy tart
Roasted green tomatoes stuffed with silken tofu, cilantro & spices, thai bbq chicken wing
Smoky butternut squash chili with pork, beans, hominy & greens
Lazy Lady Farms La Roche goat cheese, cranberry compote, pickled cherry pepper
Spiced wine poached pears, cardamom ice cream

results.description:
Friday night is the evening we get to meet to study the Bible together. We do this 1 - 2 times a month. I've been blessed by the surge of interest in this meetup.  We're a small group of Christians who like to study the Bible.  We're studying the gospel of John.  Lord willing, we will be starting in on John 4 and progressing as the Spirit leads. We love discussion and sometimes don't get over many verses.  The only prerequisite for RSVP'ing for this meetup is a love for studying the Bible and if you have that, you will enjoy your time. I would like to encourage you recent signups to RSVP and come. Also there are a bunch of you other Christians out there who haven't made it yet. Just RSVP and come.  How else will you know if you like it or not?  It's free and it's inspirational.

The meetup is held in the basement of a church we rent for the occasion located at: 42 E 5th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11218.  It's in a quiet community with plenty of curbside parking available and just across the pedestrian bridge from the Fort Hamilton Pkwy F & G train stop.  We meet at 7:30 and spend about 1.5 hrs together.

We're looking for a good time of learning from God's Word together.  God's blessings to you.  We're looking forward to seeing you at the meetup.


In Christian love,

     Tim

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Hello all! Join us for the Fall Social BBQ to say Goodbye to Good Weather!! This will be hosted at the apartment of a new member of the community. She just moved into the UES so we will also be using this as an apartment warming. She lives just off the 86th Street stop on the 456 line. Because of space limitations we will only be allowing 20 RSVPs, sorry!


This is a Potluck event! Please bring some food and/or drinks (booze) with you. Homemade items are fun but not required. There will be an electric grill for making food but we will not be buying a large quantity of food. We will provide the cutlery and basic condiments. There is a Fairway nearby at 86th between 2nd and 3rd if anyone wants to buy some stuff without carrying a long distance - Fairway is really quite cheap for this area! We usually buy our stuff there and it's a good deal and wide selection. https://goo.gl/maps/mhdULJeGZfB2 ;

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Sharp’s Appalachian Harvest, Traditional Music via 21st Century Musicians

Don't miss this multi-media folk music show featuring Jeff Davis and Brian Peters at St. John's Church, 81 Christopher Street, Manhattan.


 Sharp’s Appalachian Harvest is a special multi-media music performance by English folk musician Brian Peters and American old-time musician Jeff Davis. Their show is built around the astounding songs and music collected by Englishmen Cecil Sharp and Maud Karpeles. Traversing the Southern Appalachians over the summers of 1916 to 1918, the pair created one of the most extensive folk song collections ever made.

Brian Peters, a leading performer of English traditional songs and music, frequently tours the U.S. as a teacher and performer at such venues as the Swannanoa Gathering and Augusta Heritage Center, as well as festivals and concerts. He’s also gaining a reputation as a researcher of song history.


Jeff Davis, a protégé of Mike Seeger and Frank Warner, both collectors as well as musicians, plays banjo and fiddle and sings with a rare authenticity gained from personal contact with old time musicians.


Their multi-media show features the brightest gems from Cecil Sharp’s harvest of old ballads, dance tunes, children’s songs and gospel. They give readings from Sharp’s diaries describing vividly the hardships and triumphs of song collecting, and show his evocative photographs of the singers and of mountain life.


Contribution: $20; members: $18; fulltime students and children under 15: $10. Tickets are available at the door or online at:  http://sharp.bpt.me (service charge applies).

This event is part of Daniel Pearl World Music Days
results.name: Musical Evening: Sharp's Appalachian Harvest

results.description:
Hyphen Hub presents Visions of the Future in partnership with CultureHub

Visions of the Future is a showcase night of cutting-edge multimedia art and performance focusing on new forms of audio-visual interpretation about visions of the future. The night will feature eight leading artists presenting works of immersive audience experience. It will be presented in partnership with CultureHub at their new space in La MaMa. 

Artists involved include: Catalonian Cyborg pioneers Neil Harbisson and Moon Ribas. Harbisson will perform A Concert from Space via his antenna that is embedded into his skull. Ribas will showcase her piece Waiting for Earthquakes, where she connects her sensors to the seismology satellite in space and dance as earthquakes happen at any given moment, The two artists will perform simultaneously. 

MSHR duo and Portland-based artists Brenna Murphy and Birch Cooper produce unusual installations and live performances that revolve around a unique system of light-audio feedback, employing handmade synthesizers, sculptural interfaces and ritualistic shamanic performances, placing the human body into a dynamic relationship between the ultra-terrestrial and the tribal. 

Juan Cortes and Ricardo Arias, both artists visiting from Bogota, Colombia for MOMA’s hybrid media exhibition, present their latest performance collaborating as “The Migrants”. Tidal Flares is a performance-installation that draws its inspiration from the dramatic effect of solar flares on the Earth’s behaviors, in both its organic and its inorganic systems. The performers will interfere/interact with this activity via sensors in ways akin to those deployed by certain biological organisms such as bioluminiscent algae, frogs, tarantulas etc. 

Yucef Merhi, a New York based Venezuelan artist, will present Facial Poetry, a playful multiuser installation where facial gestures are transformed into hundreds of poems. 

Mark Bolotin will showcase The Lumiphonic Creature Choir, a futuristic installation which consists of a giant twelve-headed multimedia creature that triggers faces talking about their vision of the future. The audience will be able to interact and play directly with the voices and sounds of the Creature Choir.

Venue: CultureHub, The Downstairs at La MaMa,
66 East 4th Street, New York Times: 8 pm Tickets: General Admission: $15
Students and Artists: $5 

Click here to buy tickets.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/visions-of-the-future-with-hyphen-hub-tickets-18354621166


 This Hyphen Hub event is in collaboration with CultureHub.
results.name: Hyphen Hub Visions of the Future with CultureHub

If you've always wanted to try Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu or MMA, this is the perfect class for you!  Instructors are experienced and attentive.

We'll start the class with warm up drills, followed by technique and end with live sparring. Stop by for some great training with friendly people! All levels welcome! 

Bring your gi if you have one.  If not, we have extras to lend.  Please arrive 10 minutes prior to class.

Please note: BJJ class runs from 8-9pm and Kickboxing 9-10pm.

For more info about the academy and it's instructors:

http://www.abreceabjj.com 

Don't hesitate to inquire if you have any questions!
results.name: Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu/Kickboxing

results.description:
This Friday Night brunch will be a little different from past brunches. We will have special guest Tess Lasbrey who is a Match Maker and Relationship Coach to discuss navigating your way through love and lust in the big apple. 

Come out ready to sound off and share your gripes with dating in NYC. Prix Fixe Brunch will be $40 (Cash) $45 (Credit/Debit) and will get you starter, entree and 60 minutes of unlimited brunch cocktails. Please keep in mind that this price does not include tax and gratuity. 

If you are certain that you will be attending this brunch please text (917)[masked] to confirm your reservation. There are two slots for brunch 8pm & 10:30pm please pick a slot before you send your confirmation text. 

We encourage you to bring a friend to this event. Singles and couples are welcome.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: Real people, real connection- Making Friday night fun again in Brooklyn!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
results.how_to_find_us: soccer, indoor soccer, futsal, new york futsal, futsal across america, futbol, futbolito, fifa

results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

results.description:
Ok so I will be having a Halloween party and 5 year anniversary party for my horror Meetup group this Friday at Times Scare. For those of you who have not been there will be in for a treat. It's a year round haunted house with a bar that looks as if Dexter designed it himself.

I want to invite all my metalhead legion to this as well !!!!!!

We will take over part of the bar on Friday. They will have roaming and stage acts going on and we will host our own costume contest for great prizes.
